Class Messenger

  • java.lang.Object
    • Messenger

  • public class Messenger
extends java.lang.Object
    A Messenger class that can be used as a simple messaging program backend.
    Author:
    Chris Schmidt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Messenger()
      No argument constructor to create a Messenger object.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      • Messenger

        public Messenger()
        No argument constructor to create a Messenger object.

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String newUser)
        Add a user to the messenger. If the supplied username is already present, nothing is changed.
        Parameters:
        newUser - THe new user to add. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - for null parameters

      • getReceivedMessages

        public java.util.ArrayList<Message> getReceivedMessages(java.lang.String toUser,
                                                        Message.Status status)
        Get all messages sent to a certain user with a specified status. Sets them to read unless they are currently starred
        Parameters:
        toUser - the recipient of the messages, must be a user from the user list
        status - the relevant status
        Returns:
        the messages sent to the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user isn't in the user list

      • getReceivedMessages

        public java.util.ArrayList<Message> getReceivedMessages(java.lang.String toUser)
        Get all messages sent to a certain user. Sets them to read unless they are currently starred
        Parameters:
        toUser - the recipient of the messages, must be a user from the user list
        Returns:
        the messages sent to the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user isn't in the user list

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String from,
                        java.lang.String to,
                        java.lang.String text)
        Send a message from the specified user to the specified user with the given text
        Parameters:
        from - the sender, must be a user from the user list
        to - the recipient, must be a user from the user list
        text - the text of the message, must not be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - for a null parameter
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user isn't in the user list

      • sendSmile

        public void sendSmile(java.lang.String from,
                      java.lang.String to)
        Send a smile message from the specified user to the specified user with the given text
        Parameters:
        from - the sender, must be a user from the user list
        to - the recipient, must be a user from the user list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user isn't in the user list

      • getUserList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUserList()
        Get the current list of usernames
        Returns:
        the current list of usernames
